newsitem.title: USA: Continental Air says Air Canada shed stake.
newsitem.headline: Continental Air says Air Canada shed stake.

text.p: Continental Airlines Inc said Thursday Air Canada sold 6.6 million shares of Continental's class B stock.
Continental spokesman Dave Messing said Air Canada previously said it would divest its stake in Continental.
Air Canada was one of the main equity investors that helped bring Continental out of bankruptcy in 1993.

Air Canada has been slowly shedding its stake in Continental. The Montreal-based airline said Thursday it sold its remaining 5.6-million-share stake in Continental for of US$154 million or C$170 million in proceeds -- a 550 percent gain on its original 1993 investment.
Goldman Sachs said a block of 6.6 million shares were sold at 27-3/4, down 1.
"I'm surprised that it didn't move at a somewhat larger discount," said Samuel Buttrick, an airline analyst with PaineWebber.
Air Canada said the sale of its remaining stake in Houtson-based Continental does not affect the commercial alliance between the two airlines.
Details of which investors bought the shares were not immediately available.
Continental's B shares closed at 27-7/8, down 7/8. The class A shares closed at 28-1/2.
